questions.question: Simplify  36( 1) 9( 1) / 7 28aa bb++÷.
2bvxak= + (i) Find x when a = 2, b = 3, v = – 4 and k = 5.
2bvxak= + (ii) Rearrange the formula to make v the subject.
questions.question_type: Changing the subject of a formula

questions.question: Solve the simultaneous equations: 4x + 7y = 23, 6x - 2y = -3.
questions.question_type: Solving simultaneous equations using the method of elimination

questions.question: Write as a single fraction in its simplest form: 2 / (x - 3) - 3x / (xy - xy).
Faiz invested $25,000 in an account which paid simple interest. At the end of 9 months, the value of the investment was $26,500. Calculate the interest rate per annum of the investment.

Jane exchanged 500 Singapore dollars ($) into Thai baht (THB) when the exchange rate was $1 = 26.77 THB. She travelled to Thailand and spent 10,600 THB. On her return to Singapore, she exchanged the remaining Thai baht into dollars with the exchange rate $1 = 26.88 THB. Calculate the amount she received in dollars. Correct your answer to the nearest cent.

The cash price of a furniture set was $2700. Kim bought the set under a hire purchase scheme: 15% deposit and monthly instalments of $68 for 36 months. Calculate the amount of interest paid as a percentage of the cash price.
By selling an item at 25% discount off the marked price, a shopkeeper still makes 10% profit on his cost. If the cost price is $180, calculate the marked price of the item.
questions.question_type: Finding the original value using reverse percentages

questions.question: The diagram shows a rectangular cardboard ABCD with AB = (3x + 1) cm and AD = (x + 13) cm. A square of side 3 cm is cut from each corner. The remaining cardboard is then folded along the dotted lines to form an open rectangular box with base PQRS and height 3 cm. The volume of the tray is 930 cm^3. (a) Form an equation, in terms of x, to represent this information and show that it simplifies to 3x^2 + 16x - 345 = 0.
Solve the equation 3x^2 + 16x - 345 = 0. Give your solutions correct to two decimal places.
questions.question_type: Solving quadratic equations by quadratic formula

questions.question: Find the length of the diagonal SQ.
A is the point (3, 7) and B is the point (13, -8). (i) Find AB.
questions.question_type: Finding the magnitude of a vector

questions.question: Given that 2BA = AP, find the coordinates of P.

In triangle OCB, A is the midpoint of OC and P is the point on CB such that CP = 3/4 CB. The line OB is produced to D such that OB = 2BD. 2OA = a and 2OB = b. (i) Express CP in terms of a and b, as simply as possible.
questions.question_type: Solving a geometric problem involving vectors

questions.question: Express AP in terms of a and b, as simply as possible.
Show that A, P and D lie on the same straight line.
questions.question_type: Finding the equation of a straight line

questions.question: Find Area of ∆CPD / Area of ∆OCB.
A, B, C and D are four points on level ground, with B due east of A. AC = 43 m, CD = 32 m, AD = 67 m, angle CAB = 52° and angle ABC = 33°. (a) Calculate the bearing of B from C.
Calculate AB.
Calculate angle CDA.
questions.question_type: Finding an unknown angle involving angles at a point

questions.question: A drone hovers 60 m vertically above D. Find the angle of depression of A from the drone.

The diagram shows a circle with centre O. TA and TB are tangents to the circle at A and B respectively. AT produced meets OB produced at X. (a) Show that triangle OAX is similar to triangle TBX. Give a reason for each statement you make.
questions.question_type: Applying the angles properties of circles

questions.question: XB = 12 cm and TX = 13 cm. (i) Find OA.
(ii) Calculate, as a fraction in its simplest form, the numerical value of the ratio area of triangle OATB / area of quadrilateral TBX.
(iii) Calculate the reflex angle AOB in radians.
questions.question_type: Applying the angles properties of circles

By drawing a tangent, find the gradient of the curve at x = 3.

questions.question: The straight line y = mx – 1 intersects the curve 1610yxx= −− at two points. (i) Write down and simplify the equation, in terms of m, in the form Ax2 + Bx + 16 = 0, which is satisfied by the values of x at the points of intersection.
questions.question_type: Finding the solutions of an equation graphically

questions.question: If the values of y at the points of intersection are greater than or equal to zero, find the least value of m.
questions.question_type: Finding the solutions of an equation graphically

questions.question: Use the curve to find (i) the median mass of the eggs.
Use the curve to find (ii) the interquartile range.
Use the curve to find (iii) the 10th percentile.
An egg is classified as ‘Medium’ if its mass is greater than or equal to 50 g but less than 56 g. Two eggs are chosen at random. Calculate the probability that both are ‘Medium’ eggs.
questions.question_type: Finding the probability involving independent events

questions.question: The masses, in grams, of a second batch of 300 eggs are recorded and are represented by the box-and-whisker diagram below. (i) Which batch of the eggs has more consistent mass? Justify your answer using appropriate figures.
The right whisker is longer than the left whisker. Explain what this tells us about the distribution of the data set.

The table shows the utility charges for Chen’s family in July 2024. It includes the charges for utilities such as electricity (in kilowatt-hours), gas (in kilowatt-hours), water (in cubic metres) and refuse removal. The charges for electricity, gas and water are dependent on their usage while refuse removal is a fixed amount. (a) Calculate the values of p, r and s.

Chen considers installing an air-conditioner in his home at the beginning of August. He finds the following information from the National Environmental Agency (NEA) website on energy-efficient appliances and online electrical store. Assuming the costs for gas, water services and refuse removal charge remain unchanged, suggest the model of air-conditioner he should opt for and estimate the August utility charge. Justify any decision you make and show your calculations clearly.
